wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier General Alexander Colin Johnston DSO & Bar, MC (26 January 1884 – 27 December 1952) was an English first-class cricketer and British Army officer. Johnston was a right-handed batsman who was a leg break bowler. Johnston also occasionally played as a wicketkeeper.

response: *Alexander Johnston (1775–1849), British colonial official and orientalist in Ceylon
*Alexander Johnston (Canadian politician) (1867–1951), Canadian journalist, civil servant and politician
*Alexander Johnston (British Army officer) (1884–1952), Hampshire cricketer and army officer
*John Alexander Johnston (1858–1940), U.S. Army brigadier general
